connectionSpecification.title: Google Drive Source Spec
connectionSpecification.description:
Used during spec; allows the developer to configure the cloud provider specific options
that are needed when users configure a file-based source.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: UTC date and time in the format 2017-01-25T00:00:00.000000Z. Any file modified before this date will not be replicated.

streams.title: The list of streams to sync
streams.description: Each instance of this configuration defines a stream. Use this to define which files belong in the stream, their format, and how they should be parsed and validated. When sending data to warehouse destination such as Snowflake or BigQuery, each stream is a separate table.

globs.title: Globs
globs.description: The pattern used to specify which files should be selected from the file system. For more information on glob pattern matching look here.

validation_policy.title: Validation Policy
validation_policy.description: The name of the validation policy that dictates sync behavior when a record does not adhere to the stream schema.

input_schema.title: Input Schema
input_schema.description: The schema that will be used to validate records extracted from the file. This will override the stream schema that is auto-detected from incoming files.

primary_key.title: Primary Key
primary_key.description: The column or columns (for a composite key) that serves as the unique identifier of a record. If empty, the primary key will default to the parser's default primary key.

days_to_sync_if_history_is_full.title: Days To Sync If History Is Full
days_to_sync_if_history_is_full.description: When the state history of the file store is full, syncs will only read files that were last modified in the provided day range.

format.title: Format
format.description: The configuration options that are used to alter how to read incoming files that deviate from the standard formatting.

double_as_string.title: Convert Double Fields to Strings
double_as_string.description: Whether to convert double fields to strings. This is recommended if you have decimal numbers with a high degree of precision because there can be a loss precision when handling floating point numbers.

delimiter.title: Delimiter
delimiter.description: The character delimiting individual cells in the CSV data. This may only be a 1-character string. For tab-delimited data enter '\t'.

quote_char.title: Quote Character
quote_char.description: The character used for quoting CSV values. To disallow quoting, make this field blank.

escape_char.title: Escape Character
escape_char.description: The character used for escaping special characters. To disallow escaping, leave this field blank.

encoding.title: Encoding
encoding.description: The character encoding of the CSV data. Leave blank to default to UTF8. See list of python encodings for allowable options.

double_quote.title: Double Quote
double_quote.description: Whether two quotes in a quoted CSV value denote a single quote in the data.

null_values.title: Null Values
null_values.description: A set of case-sensitive strings that should be interpreted as null values. For example, if the value 'NA' should be interpreted as null, enter 'NA' in this field.

strings_can_be_null.title: Strings Can Be Null
strings_can_be_null.description: Whether strings can be interpreted as null values. If true, strings that match the null_values set will be interpreted as null. If false, strings that match the null_values set will be interpreted as the string itself.

skip_rows_before_header.title: Skip Rows Before Header
skip_rows_before_header.description: The number of rows to skip before the header row. For example, if the header row is on the 3rd row, enter 2 in this field.

skip_rows_after_header.title: Skip Rows After Header
skip_rows_after_header.description: The number of rows to skip after the header row.

header_definition.title: CSV Header Definition
header_definition.description: How headers will be defined. `User Provided` assumes the CSV does not have a header row and uses the headers provided and `Autogenerated` assumes the CSV does not have a header row and the CDK will generate headers using for `f{i}` where `i` is the index starting from 0. Else, the default behavior is to use the header from the CSV file. If a user wants to autogenerate or provide column names for a CSV having headers, they can skip rows.

column_names.title: Column Names
column_names.description: The column names that will be used while emitting the CSV records

true_values.title: True Values
true_values.description: A set of case-sensitive strings that should be interpreted as true values.

false_values.title: False Values
false_values.description: A set of case-sensitive strings that should be interpreted as false values.

ignore_errors_on_fields_mismatch.title: Ignore errors on field mismatch
ignore_errors_on_fields_mismatch.description: Whether to ignore errors that occur when the number of fields in the CSV does not match the number of columns in the schema.

decimal_as_float.title: Convert Decimal Fields to Floats
decimal_as_float.description: Whether to convert decimal fields to floats. There is a loss of precision when converting decimals to floats, so this is not recommended.

oneOf.title: Unstructured Document Format

skip_unprocessable_files.title: Skip Unprocessable Files
skip_unprocessable_files.description: If true, skip files that cannot be parsed and pass the error message along as the _ab_source_file_parse_error field. If false, fail the sync.

strategy.title: Parsing Strategy
strategy.description: The strategy used to parse documents. `fast` extracts text directly from the document which doesn't work for all files. `ocr_only` is more reliable, but slower. `hi_res` is the most reliable, but requires an API key and a hosted instance of unstructured and can't be used with local mode. See the unstructured.io documentation for more details: https://unstructured-io.github.io/unstructured/core/partition.html#partition-pdf

oneOf.title: Local
oneOf.description: Process files locally, supporting `fast` and `ocr` modes. This is the default option.
Extract text from document formats (.pdf, .docx, .md, .pptx) and emit as one record per file.

schemaless.title: Schemaless
schemaless.description: When enabled, syncs will not validate or structure records against the stream's schema.

recent_n_files_to_read_for_schema_discov.title: Files To Read For Schema Discover
recent_n_files_to_read_for_schema_discov.description: The number of resent files which will be used to discover the schema for this stream.

oneOf.title: Replicate Records

sync_metadata.description: If enabled, streams will sync files metadata instead of files data.
sync_metadata.title: Make stream sync files metadata

oneOf.description: Recommended - Extract and load structured records into your destination of choice. This is the classic method of moving data in Airbyte. It allows for blocking and hashing individual fields or files from a structured schema. Data can be flattened, typed and deduped depending on the destination.

oneOf.title: Copy Raw Files

preserve_directory_structure.title: Preserve Sub-Directories in File Paths
preserve_directory_structure.description: If enabled, sends subdirectory folder structure along with source file names to the destination. Otherwise, files will be synced by their names only. This option is ignored when file-based replication is not enabled.

oneOf.description: Copy raw files without parsing their contents. Bits are copied into the destination exactly as they appeared in the source. Recommended for use with unstructured text data, non-text and compressed files.

folder_url.title: Folder Url
folder_url.description: URL for the folder you want to sync. Using individual streams and glob patterns, it's possible to only sync a subset of all files located in the folder.

credentials.title: Authentication
credentials.description: Credentials for connecting to the Google Drive API

client_id.title: Client ID
client_id.description: Client ID for the Google Drive API

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: Client Secret for the Google Drive API

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: Refresh Token for the Google Drive API

service_account_info.title: Service Account Information
service_account_info.description: The JSON key of the service account to use for authorization. Read more here.
